page.title: 13Banking in Scotland
page.content: Edinburgh is the centre for {banking} and finance in Scotland.Banks are a major form of{employment.}Clearing Banks alone employ over 250,000 people in Britain. Over the last two decades{ {computers}have taken over a major role in{banking}removing much of the paper work.Through{computers}the banks can now have immediate access to files, continual update to accounts and monitor security systems etc. Special cards can be used to withdraw{money from automated cash dispensing machines which are open most of the time even when the bank is closed. Since 1931 Britain's money has not been backed by gold, but is valued on its buying power.In the future{banking may be done from the home or office using{computers}and other communication networks linked to large central computers.
